page.title: 01Aspatria
page.content: Aspatria is a small town situated along a low ridge above the River Ellen which flows in a south-westerly direction to the south of the town. This river joins the sea at Maryport which is 8 miles away.Aspatria is built along the main Maryport to Carlisle road. The road from Cockermouth to Silloth crosses this road in Aspatria. Around this junction are old coaching inns still showing evidence of the era of horse-drawn travel,such as a mounting-block. Also at this junction is a petrol station to cater for our current form of travel, the car. There are two schools in the town, Beacon Hill, an 11 to 16 years old comprehensive, and Richmond Hill County Primary School, which is a 5 to 11 years old infant and junior
